subject: RE: [junit] How to record test results in XML format
msgSnippet: ... Maybe the integrated JBuilder s JUnit and/or Ant are being used instead of the the version You installed separately. Adding the optional.jar to the wrong
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...]
>
>
> O.K. anyone else feel free to jump in... (thanks J.B.)
>
> try putting optional.jar on your CLASSPATH as well...
>
> It generally isn't this hard.
>
> BTW: I thought JBungler had an Ant integration module.

Maybe the integrated JBuilder's JUnit and/or Ant are being used instead of
the the version You installed separately. Adding the optional.jar to the
wrong lib directory wouldn't solve anything.
Search your harddisk(s) for ant.jar, I suspect you will find more than
one...

>
> =jason
>
